author: mlycklama@idahostatesman.com (Michael Lycklama)
title: Smoke postpones district soccer tournaments
text:
Smoke postpones district soccer tournaments Posted by Michael Lycklama on October 12, 2015 2015-10-12T20:51:30Z 
Commuters on the Boise Connector were greeted Monday morning by hazy skies. JOHN SOWELL — jsowell@idahostatesman.com 
Smoke from the Walker Fire southwest of Idaho City flooded the Treasure Valley on Monday , postponing the 5A and 4A District Three boys and girls soccer tournaments. 
Tournament managers pushed all Monday games to the same times and locations Tuesday. 
The 5A boys tournament pushed all of its games except the district final and fifth-place game back 24 hours. Those two games would conflict with JV football games on Thursday. A time and place won’t be determined for the championship and fifth-place game until Tuesday. 
The Idaho Department of Environmental Quality forecasted another red air quality alert for Tuesday. District athletic directors will meet Tuesday morning to go over contingency plans in case smoke forces the cancellation of Tuesday’s games. 
Each tournament needs to play three rounds before state play-in games Saturday. 
Complete and updated district brackets are available below. 
Girls soccer
